intro: Clathrotropis brachypetala, commonly known as the short-petalled clathrotropis, is a tropical shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the Fabaceae family, which includes many plants with nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant features compound leaves with small, paired leaflets and produces yellow to orange flowers that are clustered in racemes. Its fruits are legumes, typically containing several seeds, and it thrives in humid, tropical environments. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and research settings.
